itemDescription: Scottich missionary involved in is god female?

wikipedia_page.main: Anne Hepburn (20 August 1925 – 29 July 2016) was a Church of Scotland missionary and a teacher, feminist and social justice advocate and wife and mother. She served as National President of the Church of Scotland's Women's Guild in the early 1980s, where she led the debate on the issue of the "Motherhood of God".

response: *Anne Hepburn, missionary was born here in 1925Thanksgiving Service for the life of Anne Hepburn [Order of Service]. Motherhood of God Papers, New College Library. (Mrs Hepburn's papers relating to the Motherhood of God Controversy were donated to New College Library in 2016).
*Anne Hepburn, 90, Scottish missionary and teacher.Obituary: Anne Hepburn missionary, teacher, feminist and Guild President
